already_attached.text: Your fly is already attached, though it's giving you a look that suggests it's having second thoughts about this partnership.

mishaps.text: The fly attaches perfectly, but somehow you've also managed to attach your sleeve to the line.
After twenty minutes of increasingly creative cursing, you've successfully tied seventeen different knots, none of which actually involve the fly.

success.text: The fly attaches with surgical precision. Your knot would make a sailor weep with envy.
A perfect knot! The fly dangles elegantly, ready to deceive the most sophisticated trout.

mishaps.text: The rod sections refuse to fit together properly. After ten minutes of increasingly undignified wrestling, you realize you've been trying to attach the handle to itself.
You successfully assemble the rod, but somehow it's now three feet longer than when you started. The laws of physics appear to be taking a tea break.

success.text: You expertly assemble your Allcocks Harvey Torbett 10-foot split cane Avon rod. The honey-colored bamboo gleams in the morning light, red agate rings catching the sun, bronze ferrules clicking together with satisfying precision. A rod worthy of its namesake.

The two 4-foot sections of your Harvey Torbett rod unite with practiced ease. Harvey adjusts the alloy screw reel seat and admires the red whipping - craftsmanship from an era when rods were built to last.

no_rod.text: You attempt to cast with no rod assembled. This goes about as well as you'd expect. A nearby duck appears to be laughing.

no_fly.text: You cast with no fly attached. The line sails gracefully through the air, achieving absolutely nothing with remarkable efficiency.

early_mishaps.text: Your cast goes slightly awry, landing in a nearby bush. The bush seems offended.
The line tangles mid-cast, creating what can only be described as a three-dimensional puzzle that would challenge Stephen Hawking.
Your cast achieves a respectable distance but somehow manages to hook a passing cloud. Meteorology was never your strong suit.

medium_mishaps.text: Your cast achieves new heights of creative failure, somehow managing to hook your own hat while simultaneously frightening a family of ducks.
The fly line develops what appears to be sentience, wrapping itself around everything except what you intended.
Your cast goes spectacularly wrong, creating a Gordian knot that Alexander the Great would have found challenging. A nearby angler offers his condolences.

late_mishaps.text: Your cast defies several laws of physics, creating a temporal paradox that somehow results in you hooking a fish that hasn't been born yet.
The cast goes so spectacularly wrong that local wildlife has gathered to watch. You're pretty sure that otter is taking notes.
Your casting technique has achieved such legendary status that the Royal Society of Angling Disasters has sent a representative to document it for posterity.

no_cast.text: You attempt to reel in a line you haven't cast. This is either advanced meditation or the early stages of a complete breakdown.

catches.text: You reel in... a boot. It's not even a matching pair with the one you caught yesterday.
Success! You've caught a magnificent... stick. The stick appears unimpressed by your angling prowess.
You reel in what might be the world's most philosophical piece of pond weed. It seems to be judging your life choices.
A soggy newspaper emerges from the depths, featuring yesterday's cricket scores and a crossword puzzle that's already been completed incorrectly.
You've successfully caught a rubber duck. It squeaks accusingly, as if questioning your life choices.

already_eaten.text: You've already eaten your sandwich. You consider eating the wrapper, but even your standards haven't fallen that far. Yet.

soggy.text: The sandwich has achieved the consistency of wet cardboard. You eat it anyway, because you're British and this is what we do.

sentient.text: The sandwich appears to have developed opinions about being eaten. You negotiate a peaceful resolution involving shared custody of the pickle.

normal.text: You enjoy a perfectly adequate sandwich. The cucumber is crisp, the butter properly applied. For a moment, all is right with the world.
The sandwich is a masterpiece of British culinary engineering: proper butter, fresh cucumber, crusts removed with surgical precision. Harvey's mother would be proud.

intact.text: You wade deeper with confidence. The water is refreshingly cool, and you feel at one with nature. This feeling lasts approximately thirty seconds.
Harvey wades deeper into the crystal-clear water, feeling like a proper chalk stream angler. The cool water around his legs is invigorating.

leaking.text: You wade deeper despite your leaking waders. The cold water is now providing an intimate massage of your lower extremities.
Harvey bravely continues deeper despite the obvious wader malfunction. British stoicism in the face of aquatic adversity.

flooded.text: You wade deeper in your completely flooded waders. You're now essentially wearing a portable pond. Fish are considering moving in.
Harvey continues his aquatic adventure in what can only be described as 'wearable water features.' His dedication to the sport is admirable, if misguided.

tie_knot.text: You tie a knot with the precision of a master craftsman. It's either a perfect blood knot or you've accidentally invented a new form of modern art.
Your knot-tying session results in what can only be described as a three-dimensional puzzle that would challenge a mathematician.
You successfully tie what appears to be a Gordian knot. Alexander the Great would be impressed, though probably not in a good way.
Perfect! A textbook blood knot that would make Izaak Walton himself nod in approval. Harvey's grandfather would be proud.

clean_glasses.text: You clean your glasses with meticulous care. The world comes into sharp focus, revealing just how badly your last cast went.
You clean your glasses, only to realize the problem wasn't your vision - reality really is this absurd.
Perfect! Now you can see the fish laughing at you in high definition.
Harvey polishes his scholarly spectacles with a proper lens cloth. Clear vision is essential for proper observation and documentation.

adjust_hat.text: You adjust your hat to the perfect angle of scholarly contemplation. You feel 23% more distinguished.
You adjust your hat, but it seems to have developed its own opinions about proper positioning.
Your hat is now perfectly positioned, but a magpie has decided it would make an excellent nest.
Hat adjusted to the precise angle favored by gentleman anglers since time immemorial. Harvey cuts a distinguished figure.

change_fly.text: You select a different fly with the care of a wine connoisseur choosing a vintage. This one has 'success' written all over it.
You change flies with scientific precision, though the fish appear to have formed a committee to discuss your tactical choices.
You select a Parachute Adams, but it immediately requests a parachute instructor.
Harvey chooses a classic Blue Winged Olive, a fly pattern that has fooled trout since his grandfather's time. Tradition and technique combined.

check_time.text: Your pocket watch indicates it's precisely the time when fish traditionally ignore all human endeavors. How convenient.
According to your calculations, you've been fishing for exactly long enough to question all your life choices.
Your watch indicates it's teatime, which explains everything.
Harvey consults his grandfather's pocket watch - a reliable timepiece that has witnessed decades of angling adventures. Time moves differently by the water.

check_weather.text: The weather is behaving with typical British unpredictability. It's simultaneously perfect for fishing and completely wrong for fishing.
The meteorological conditions suggest that somewhere, in a parallel universe, you're probably catching fish.
The weather is absolutely perfect for fishing, which is precisely why nothing will go according to plan.
Harvey observes the atmospheric conditions with the eye of a natural philosopher. Barometric pressure, wind direction, cloud formation - all factors in the grand equation of angling success.

check_gear.text: Harvey conducts a methodical inspection of his equipment. Everything appears to be in working order, which is somehow more concerning than if something were obviously broken.
A thorough gear check reveals that your equipment is functioning perfectly. The problem, therefore, must lie elsewhere. Probably with the fish.
Your gear inspection reveals that everything is in perfect working order, which means the universe will now conspire to prove you wrong.

merry.text: Harvey ties the fly with considerably more confidence than usual! 'Splendid little fellow, this fly! We shall catch fish together!' *slight wobble*
The fly attaches beautifully! Harvey hums a little tune while admiring his handiwork. Everything seems much more manageable after that delightful discovery.

jolly.text: Harvey declares this to be 'absolutely the finest fly-tying in recorded history!' The fly may be slightly crooked, but his enthusiasm is infectious. *hic*
The fly practically ties itself! Harvey is convinced he's discovered a revolutionary new technique. 'I shall write a paper on this!' *hic*

tipsy.text: Harvey ties the fly while conducting an animated lecture to a passing duck about the philosophical implications of artificial insects. The duck seems genuinely interested. *hic*

merry.text: The rod assembles with remarkable ease! Harvey feels a surge of confidence in his angling abilities. 'Grandfather's rod knows what it's about!'

jolly.text: Harvey assembles the rod while humming 'Rule Britannia' and declares it 'the finest piece of British engineering since the steam engine!' *hic*

tipsy.text: The rod practically assembles itself! Harvey is convinced it's responding to his newfound joie de vivre. 'We understand each other now, don't we old friend?' *hic*

merry.text: Harvey's cast has considerably more flair than usual! It may not have gone where intended, but it was executed with panache! 'Style over substance, as they say!'

jolly.text: The cast goes magnificently wrong, but Harvey applauds his own effort! 'Bravo! A truly spectacular demonstration of the chaos theory in action!' *hic*

tipsy.text: Harvey's cast defies all known laws of physics, but he's delighted with the result! 'I've invented a new casting technique! I shall call it the Torbett Spiral!' *hic*

merry.text: The sandwich tastes absolutely magnificent! Harvey savors every bite while contemplating the perfect harmony of cucumber and butter. 'Mother's recipe, you know!'

jolly.text: Harvey declares this to be 'the finest sandwich in the history of British cuisine!' He may be slightly biased, but his enthusiasm is genuine. *hic*

tipsy.text: The sandwich is absolutely divine! Harvey begins composing an ode to cucumber sandwiches while eating. 'Oh cucumber, thou crisp delight...' *hic*

merry.text: Harvey wades deeper with the confidence of a man who has discovered life's simple pleasures! The water feels wonderfully refreshing.

jolly.text: Wading deeper seems like an absolutely brilliant idea! Harvey splashes forward with enthusiasm, declaring the water 'perfectly temperate!' *hic*

tipsy.text: Harvey wades deeper while singing a sea shanty! 'What shall we do with a drunken angler, early in the morning!' The fish seem to appreciate the entertainment. *hic*

merry.text: Harvey ties the knot with flourish and confidence! 'A perfect blood knot, executed with the precision of a gentleman scholar!'

jolly.text: The knot practically ties itself! Harvey is convinced he's channeling the spirit of ancient mariners. 'The sea calls to me!' *hic*

tipsy.text: Harvey creates what he believes to be a revolutionary new knot! It may look like abstract art, but he's thoroughly pleased with his innovation. *hic*

merry.text: Harvey polishes his spectacles with extra care, humming contentedly. 'Clear vision for clear thinking, as grandfather always said!'

jolly.text: The glasses practically sparkle! Harvey declares his vision 'magnificently enhanced' and ready for 'scholarly observation of the highest order!' *hic*

tipsy.text: Harvey cleans his glasses while delivering an impromptu lecture on optics to a bemused heron. 'The refraction of light through properly maintained lenses...' *hic*

merry.text: Harvey observes the weather with renewed optimism! 'Absolutely perfect conditions for angling success! The barometric pressure is most encouraging!'

jolly.text: The weather is absolutely magnificent! Harvey begins composing meteorological poetry. 'Oh clouds, ye harbingers of piscine possibility!' *hic*

tipsy.text: Harvey declares the weather 'cosmically aligned for angling triumph!' He may be negotiating with the clouds, but his enthusiasm is infectious. *hic*

merry.text: The fly attaches to Harvey's sleeve, but he finds this absolutely charming! 'Look! I've invented wearable fishing technology!' *slight wobble*
After tying seventeen creative knots, Harvey declares it 'an artistic triumph!' The fly remains unattached, but his spirits are high.

jolly.text: Harvey's knot-tying session creates what he enthusiastically calls 'a three-dimensional masterpiece of angling engineering!' The fly is somewhere in there. *hic*
The fly has somehow attached itself to Harvey's hat, but he's delighted! 'Mobile fly storage! I'm a genius!' *hic*

tipsy.text: Harvey has created what appears to be a small sculpture made entirely of fishing line and enthusiasm. The fly is involved somehow. 'I shall exhibit this at the Royal Academy!' *hic*
The fly-tying session has resulted in Harvey being more attached to the line than the fly is. He finds this philosophically fascinating. 'Man and equipment in perfect harmony!' *hic*

merry.text: The rod sections refuse to cooperate, but Harvey finds their independence admirable! 'Spirited equipment! I respect that in a fishing rod!'
Harvey has somehow assembled a rod that's three feet longer than it should be, and he's absolutely thrilled! 'Extended reach! Revolutionary!'

jolly.text: The rod assembly has gone magnificently wrong, but Harvey applauds the effort! 'Bravo, rod! You've exceeded all expectations!' *hic*
Harvey has created what he believes to be 'the world's first modular fishing system!' It may not resemble a traditional rod, but his innovation is boundless. *hic*

tipsy.text: The rod assembly has achieved what Harvey calls 'transcendent complexity!' He's not entirely sure how it works, but he's convinced it's brilliant. *hic*
Harvey has somehow assembled the rod inside-out and backwards, but declares it 'a revolutionary approach to traditional angling!' The physics are questionable, but his enthusiasm is infectious. *hic*

early_mishaps_merry.text: The cast lands in a bush, but Harvey finds this delightfully rustic! 'I'm fishing for tree trout! An unexplored species!'
The line tangles magnificently, and Harvey declares it 'a three-dimensional puzzle worthy of academic study!' He begins taking notes.

medium_mishaps_jolly.text: Harvey hooks his own hat and declares it 'the finest catch of the day!' The ducks applaud, which he takes as professional recognition. *hic*
The fly line achieves sentience and wraps around everything in sight. Harvey is thrilled! 'I've created artificial life! Nobel Prize, here I come!' *hic*

late_mishaps_tipsy.text: Harvey's cast creates a temporal paradox, but he's absolutely delighted! 'I've revolutionized both angling AND physics! Grandfather would be so proud!' *hic*
The cast goes so spectacularly wrong that Harvey begins conducting the gathered wildlife like an orchestra. 'Ladies and gentlemen, I present: Chaos in B-flat!' *hic*
Harvey's casting technique has attracted representatives from the Royal Society, but he's convinced they're here to offer him a knighthood. 'Sir Harvey has a nice ring to it!' *hic*

merry.text: Harvey reels in a magnificent boot and declares it 'a fine specimen of industrial archaeology!' He begins cataloguing its features.
The philosophical pond weed is judging Harvey's life choices, but he finds this intellectually stimulating! 'Finally, a worthy debate partner!'

jolly.text: Harvey catches a rubber duck and immediately names it 'Professor Quackers!' He begins discussing angling theory with his new colleague. *hic*
The soggy newspaper contains yesterday's cricket scores, which Harvey finds absolutely fascinating! 'Research material! The intersection of sport and aquatic preservation!' *hic*

tipsy.text: Harvey reels in what appears to be a small ecosystem and declares himself 'the discoverer of a new form of aquatic civilization!' He begins diplomatic negotiations. *hic*
The catch of the day is a tin can containing a strongly worded letter to the River Authority. Harvey finds this 'absolutely riveting correspondence!' and begins composing a reply. *hic*

leaking_merry.text: Harvey's waders are leaking, but he finds the aquatic massage 'rather invigorating!' British stoicism at its finest.

flooded_jolly.text: Harvey's completely flooded waders have become 'portable aquariums!' He's convinced he's pioneered a new form of mobile marine biology. *hic*

flooded_tipsy.text: Harvey declares his flooded waders 'the ultimate in immersive angling technology!' He begins lecturing passing fish on the benefits of human-aquatic integration. *hic*
